cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
SECRET.
Operations.
From:- General Delme Radcliffe, Italy.
To:- C.I.G.S., War Office.
Handed in at 11 a.m. 19.12.17.
Received at 5.50 p.m. 19.12.17.
10056.
Operations night of December 18th.
4th Army 27th Corps.
On Asolone Italian line passes along S.W. slopes of the mountain through Casera - Santino.
4th Army Corps. After resisting attacks in Cesilla sector has rectified its line, which now runs through Casone Coldelle Farine and Casone del Bassetto joining the former line at Cima - Tasson.
The line Col Moschin Col Fenelon Col Raniero Col Dell Gallo is being fortified and a connection is being made with the line Mt. Coston Mt. Oro.
Line Col Moschin to Mt. Oro is being held by troops available.
In the evening enemy's fire died away.
3rd Army.
Between Casera Gradenigo and Cavazoccherina enemy attempted to cross the Sile at five points with boats and a foot-bridge. He only succeeded in occupying eastern part of river bend at Casera Longo.
A local counter attack failed.
There was another counter attack at 3.30 p.m but result of this is not yet known. Other attempts of enemy to pass about Idrovera Rossi above Cavazoccherina and at Palazzo Brazza were driven back.
